Key Match Events: KL Rahul dragged a 141kph dart from Archer back onto his stumps for 1
Iyer tried his best to give India's bowlers something to defend, but that soon became next to nothing once Roy and Buttler got cracking
Roy muscled the legspinner for six first ball and then crunched him behind point for another boundary
Buttler, too, joined the fun, dashing out of the crease and swiping Patel over midwicket for six
Archer returned at the death to get Hardik Pandya and Shardul Thakur off consecutive deliveries, but Sundar denied him a hat-trick
Iyer brought up his third T20I half-century
Dawid Malan and Johnny Bairstow took them home by batting at a similar high gear and throwing down the gauntlet to India for the rest of the series
Pre-Game Insights: India captain Virat Kohli had promised a similar gung-ho approach from their top order on the eve of the series opener, but while the intent was there, the execution was awry
Post-Match Reflections: Jofra Archer, Mark Wood and Chris Jordan ambushed India with blistering pace and trampoline bounce, taking the two-paced Ahmedabad track out of the equation and reminding the world why they are the No.1-ranked T20I side
England's irresistible attack consigned India to 22 for 3 in first six overs - their second-lowest powerplay score in T20Is
India could only get to 124 for 7 in the first T20I, with England sealing an eight-wicket win
Miscellaneous Highlights: England stormed to 50 for 0 in their powerplay in the chase
Jason Roy and Jos Buttler repeatedly mowed India's depleted attack to the boundary
Archer who set the tone for England by removing Rahul and marking his return from an elbow injury with a second-ball strike
Wood capped his spell with a 149kph delivery that was just about diffused to third man
Iyer smartly used the pace and bounce of England's bowlers to his advantage, picking 36 of his 67 runs square of the wicket or behind square
Others: Ian Bell: Jofra Archer is 'a real entertainer' when he bowls like this
Deivarayan Muthu is a sub-editor at ESPNcricinfo
